topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Maggie opens with a mindset about doing whatever it takes, and Lenny introduces her background (Toast, Drift, TripAdvisor, Olympic speed skating) and what they’ll cover in the episode.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Productroadmap.ai (AI roadmapping aligned to revenue) and Composer (algorithmic trading platform with AI tools).

topics.title: Three traits of the best PMs
topics.summary: Maggie shares three consistent traits she sees in top PMs across company stages: simplifying/prioritizing, following up on results, and “carrying the water” (doing unglamorous work to drive outcomes).

topics.title: How to build the simplification muscle
topics.summary: They discuss practical ways to simplify: read writing out loud, restate the core point, get feedback from experienced leaders, and resist constant re-litigation of priorities.

topics.title: Writing tactics and peer feedback loops
topics.summary: Concrete writing heuristics (rule of three, cut the first paragraphs, Minto Pyramid) and the value of a small trusted peer group to edit and pressure-test thinking.

topics.title: Following up on results to learn and advance
topics.summary: Maggie explains why post-launch follow-ups are rare but high leverage: set calendar reminders, share outcomes proactively, and use learnings to improve future bets and visibility.

topics.title: How long it takes to get good
topics.summary: They discuss realistic timelines for PM mastery, why depth (seeing multiple cycles) can accelerate learning, and the tradeoffs of job hopping vs staying to observe consequences.

topics.title: Carrying the water and doing unglamorous work
topics.summary: Maggie argues that PMs own outcomes, so anything that blocks success is “your job”—including QA, support, sales calls, implementation, and keeping team morale high.

topics.title: Breaking into product management
topics.summary: Maggie shares common entry paths (internal transfer, startups, limited APM programs), why hiring career-switchers is manager-intensive, and why getting the first PM title is pivotal.

topics.title: A tactical template for writing product strategy
topics.summary: Maggie outlines a practical strategy doc structure: mission/goals, landscape (market, competitors, risks), current state (product, customer feedback, tech constraints), opportunity, challenges, solution bets, and sequencing—shared openly to align debate on facts.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Eppo, an A/B testing and feature management platform for modern experimentation and deep analysis.
